verses.verse: A Call to Worship and Obedience (2 Sam 22.47; Ps 100.1) O come, let us sing to the LORD; let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation!
(Ps 81.2; 100.4; Mic 6.6) Let us come into his presence with thanksgiving; let us make a joyful noise to him with songs of praise!
(Ps 96.4; 97.9; 135.5) For the LORD is a great God and a great King above all gods.
In his hand are the depths of the earth; the heights of the mountains are his also.
(Gen 1.9, 10) The sea is his, for he made it, and the dry land, which his hands have formed.
(Ps 99.5, 9; 100.3) O come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before the LORD, our Maker!
(Ps 79.13; 100.3; Heb 3.7-11) For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. O that today you would listen to his voice!
(Ex 17.2, 7; Deut 6.16) Do not harden your hearts, as at Meribah, as on the day at Massah in the wilderness,
(Ps 78.18; 1 Cor 10.9) when your ancestors tested me and put me to the proof, though they had seen my work.
(Heb 3.10, 17) For forty years I loathed that generation and said, “They are a people whose hearts go astray, and they do not regard my ways.”
(Heb 4.3, 5) Therefore in my anger I swore, “They shall not enter my rest.”
